Package: com.android.build.gradle.internal.dsl

[Java] Class SplitOptions

    • com.android.build.gradle.internal.dsl.SplitOptions

    • Base data representing how an APK should be split for a given dimension (density, abi).

      • Methods Summary

      • Method Detail

        • public void exclude(@com.android.annotations.NonNull String... excludes)

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull public Set<String> getApplicableFilters(@com.android.annotations.NonNull Set<String> allFilters)

          Returns a list of all applicable filters for this dimension. The list can return null, indicating that the no-filter option must also be used.

          Parameters:
          allFilters - the available filters, excluding the no-filter option.
          Returns:
          the filters to use.

        • public Set<String> getExclude()

          Collection of exclude patterns.

        • public Set<String> getInclude()

          Collection of include patterns.

        • public void include(@com.android.annotations.NonNull String... includes)

        • public boolean isEnable()

          Whether to split in this dimension.

        • public void reset()

          Resets the list of included split configuration. Use this before calling include, in order to manually configure the list of configuration to split on, rather than excluding from the default list.

        • public void setEnable(boolean enable)

        • public void setExclude(@com.android.annotations.NonNull List<String> list)

          Collection of exclude patterns.

        • public void setInclude(@com.android.annotations.NonNull List<String> list)
